summary:

Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali has raised concerns over a supposed divide within the Indian cricket team, suggesting that captain Rohit Sharma and head coach Gautam Gambhir are not aligned on strategic decisions.

  • Basit criticized Rohit's leadership after a string of poor performances against Australia.
  • He pointed out a lack of consensus between the captain and coach during critical matches.
  • Concerns were raised about the team's heavy reliance on star bowler Bumrah.
  • Ali questioned team selection decisions, highlighting the absence of left-arm pace options.
  • The Indian team struggled significantly in their match against Australia, facing issues at 51/4 at stumps on Day 3.
"If I say it's Bumrah vs Australia, that will be right. Similarly, it's Travis Head vs India..." - Basit Ali

This situation highlights ongoing strategic challenges as the Indian team navigates high-pressure matches against formidable opponents.

summary:
'Can't Babysit Anyone, Need To Get His Work Ethic Right': Shreyas Iyer's Brutal Reality-Check To Prithvi Shaw

Date: December 16, 2024, Source: News18

Shreyas Iyer, Mumbai's skipper, has challenged Prithvi Shaw to improve his work ethics to unlock his vast potential. Iyer believes that Shaw's talent is unparalleled but insists that the drive to perform must come from within the player.

  • Shaw scored 197 runs in nine games but did not achieve a 50+ score.
  • Iyer emphasizes that talent alone is not enough without a strong work ethic.
  • The Mumbai skipper suggests that Shaw must take personal responsibility for his performance.
“He has to focus. He has to sit back and put a thinking cap on. He will get the answer by himself. No one can force him to do anything,” said Iyer.

Iyer's comments underline a crucial moment for Shaw, once seen as a rising star in cricket, as he needs to rediscover his form and regain his place in the national team.
newTitle: 'Can't Babysit Anyone': Shreyas Iyer's Call to Prithvi Shaw to Improve Work Ethic

summary:
Gukesh Bungee Jumps, Gets Hero's Welcome Back In India

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Chess.com

New World Champion Gukesh Dommaraju fulfilled a promise to bungee jump before his return to India, where he was greeted with an incredible hero's welcome in Chennai. His arrival was marked by a significantly larger crowd compared to that of Ding Liren, who had a quieter welcome back in Hangzhou, China.

  • Gukesh honored a promise to bungee jump in Singapore.
  • He faced a wild crowd upon arrival in Chennai.
  • Gukesh expressed gratitude for the support he received from fans.
  • Ding Liren had a more subdued welcome home in Hangzhou.
“I am very glad to be here, I could see the support that and what it means to India...You guys are amazing. You gave me so much energy...” — Gukesh Dommaraju

Gukesh reflected on his journey and ambitions, asserting that this is only the beginning of his path in chess.
newTitle: Gukesh Bungee Jumps and Receives Hero's Welcome in India

title: Rohan Jaitley re-elected as DDCA president, defeats TMC's Kirti Azad - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rohan Jaitley Re-elected as DDCA President, Defeats Kirti Azad

Published on: Dec 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Rohan Jaitley has been re-elected as the president of the Delhi District Cricket Association (DDCA) after winning a closely contested election against Kirti Azad.

  • Jaitley secured 1,577 votes while Azad received 777 votes.
  • A total of 2,413 votes were cast, with 1,207 needed to win.
  • Jaitley’s group won all other executive posts as well, including Shikha Kumar as vice president.
  • Azad, a former cricketer and current TMC MP, alleged corruption in DDCA during his campaign.
  • Rohan is the son of Arun Jaitley, who previously served as DDCA president for 14 years.
“The city’s cricket body spent only a fraction of the ₹140 crore it got from BCCI last year.” - Kirti Azad

This re-election continues Jaitley’s leadership in a critical period for cricket administration in Delhi.
newTitle: Rohan Jaitley Re-elected as DDCA President, Defeats Kirti Azad

title: England seize control in new-ball onslaught as South Africa collapse - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
England seize control in new-ball onslaught as South Africa collapse

Publication Date: Not specified Source: ESPN Cricinfo

England declared their innings at 395 for 9 and took a lead of 145 runs against South Africa, who were bowled out for 281.

  • Laura Wolvaardt, Marizanne Kapp, and Sune Luus each scored half-centuries but couldn't convert them into three figures.
  • Lauren Bell achieved career-best bowling figures of 4 for 49, contributing to South Africa's collapse.
  • South Africa lost 7 wickets for just 44 runs, tarnishing their good starts earlier in the match.
  • Partnerships of 92 and a record 99 runs for the fourth wicket were not enough to stabilize the innings.
  • England's seamers were particularly effective, well managed by captain Heather Knight.
“South Africa could have benefitted from a referral. Kapp was convinced she had Tammy Beaumont out but was given not out.”

In conclusion, England has firmly taken control of the match, leaving South Africa in a precarious position as they look to salvage their innings in the face of a significant deficit.
newTitle: England Take Charge as South Africa Falters in Test Match

title: Anil Kumble breaks silence after fake quotes on Virat Kohli's form, Rohit Sharma's captaincy spark social media outrage - Hindustan Times
summary:
Anil Kumble Addresses Fake Quotes on Social Media Regarding Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricket captain Anil Kumble has issued a statement condemning the circulation of fake quotes attributed to him concerning Virat Kohli's performance and Rohit Sharma's captaincy, amidst the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Kumble clarified that these quotes do not reflect his opinions.
  • The misinformation has led to social media outrage.
  • Kumble urged fans to verify information before sharing it.
  • Sunil Gavaskar faced a similar issue recently, with fake news targeting him.
“It has come to my attention that some social media accounts are using my image and attributing fabricated quotes to me. I want to categorically deny any association with these accounts and their content.”

Kumble's statement highlights the growing issue of fake news in the cricketing community, urging vigilance among fans.
newTitle: Anil Kumble Addresses Fake Quotes on Social Media Regarding Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma

title: Jasprit Bumrah Told To Quit Test Cricket By Shoaib Akhtar: "Team Will Start Questioning..." - NDTV Sports
'Virat Kohli brought this upon himself...': Gavaskar admits 'worrying' signs over India great's repetitive dismissals - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gavaskar Expresses Concern Over Kohli's Repetitive Dismissals

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli continues to struggle with wide deliveries in Test cricket, facing criticism for his dismissals. Experts like Sunil Gavaskar comment on his need for greater discipline at the crease.

  • Kohli was dismissed for just 3 runs in the first innings of the Brisbane Test.
  • His dismissal came while chasing a wide delivery from Josh Hazlewood, leading to India being 22/3.
  • Gavaskar criticizes Kohli's eagerness to chase deliveries outside the off-stump.
  • He advises Kohli to take his time and not play aggressively too early in his innings.
  • Kohli scored a century in the first Test but has struggled in subsequent innings.
“In the earlier three dismissals, there was nothing wrong. (But) this one, he brought this upon himself because he could've left that ball well alone.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The ongoing struggles of Virat Kohli raise concerns about his form and adaptability against quality seam bowling.
newTitle: Gavaskar Expresses Concern Over Kohli's Repetitive Dismissals
